page.title: 18Halewood - the last 40 years
page.content: One of the older residents interviewed was Mrs Copeland. Mrs Copeland is a sidesperson at St Nicholas' Church and a member of the church council. Her husband is a church warden. Mrs Copeland was a housewife in Halewood in 1945. She has lived in Halewood all of her life. Her husband worked for the railways. They used to live in the railway cottages, now demolished, which were near to where Plantation School now stands. In 1945 people walked or caught the bus to work. A few people had bicycles and very few had a car. Buses were infrequent - if you missed one you had to wait two hours for the next. Mrs Copeland said that after the war all of the children had a big party in the fields behind their houses. Halewood was all farmland with a few houses here and there.
